alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lafayette; Miller (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 02 at 11:14PM CST until March 03 at 12:15AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Miller County in southwestern Arkansas... Lafayette County in southwestern Arkansas... Southwestern Columbia County in southwestern Arkansas... Webster Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Northwestern Caddo Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Bossier Parish in northwestern Louisiana... East central Harrison County in northeastern Texas... * Until 1215 AM CST. * At 1113 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Garland to near Belcher to near Greenwood, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Magnolia, Springhill, Stamps, Waldo, McNeil, Haughton, Greenwood, Blanchard, Waskom, Benton, Cullen, Plain Dealing, Cotton Valley, Oil City, Sarepta, Doyline, Mooringsport and Bradley. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for southwestern Arkansas...and northeastern Texas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until midnight CST for southwestern Arkansas...and northwestern Louisiana. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
